data.text:
Who are Tim Henman's children? Tim Henman is a former British professional tennis player. He was born on September 6, 1974, in Oxford, England. He is married to Lucy Heald, and they have four children: Olivia (born in 2007), Rose (born in 2009), Grace (born in 2011), and Jack (born in 2014).

Henman was a successful tennis player, reaching a career-high ranking of world number 4. He won 11 singles titles and 5 doubles titles during his career. He also represented Great Britain in the Davis Cup and the Olympics.

Henman retired from tennis in 2007. He is now a commentator and pundit for the BBC and Amazon Prime Video.

Henman is a popular figure in British tennis. He is known for his sportsmanship and his commitment to the sport. He is also a role model for young tennis players.
